title: How to Video and Voice Call Your Friends on Snapchat

steps.title: Open the Snapchat Chats screen.
steps.content: Open the Snapchat Chats screen. To do so, open the Snapchat app, then tap the speech bubble icon at the bottom of the screen. If you haven't updated Snapchat in a while, you'll want to grab the latest version so that you have access to the new voice and video calling features. You can update the Snapchat app using the Google Play Store on Android or the App Store on iPhone and iPad . Voice calls are not available in all areas.

steps.title: Open a chat with the person you want to call.
steps.content: Open a chat with the person you want to call. You can do so by tapping the person you want to chat with on the Chats menu or tapping the blue pen-and-paper icon in the lower-right corner and then tapping the person you want to chat with. If the person you want to call is not a Snapchat friend, you will need to find out their username and add them as a friend .

steps.title: Tap the Phone icon to place a voice call.
steps.content: Tap the Phone icon to place a voice call. You may be warned that calls will use Wi-Fi or mobile data. The call will be placed, and the recipient will receive a notification that they are being called. If they have notifications enabled for Snapchat, they'll be notified no matter what they're doing. If they don't have notifications enabled, they'll only see the incoming call if they're using Snapchat at the time. If you get a "Busy ðŸ˜«" message, the recipient cannot answer a call now. You can check if a friend is online using the map .

steps.title: Wait for the other person to pick up.
steps.content: Wait for the other person to pick up. The recipient will have the option to either just listen or join the conversation completely. If they choose to listen, they'll be able to hear you, but you won't be able to hear them. If you're receiving a call, you can tap "Listen" to just listen to their audio, "Join" to make it a two-way conversation, or "Ignore" to ignore the call.

steps.title: Hold the phone away from your face to activate speaker phone.
steps.content: Hold the phone away from your face to activate speaker phone. When you hold the phone away from your face, Snapchat will automatically switch to speaker phone. Bring it up to your face to return to regular call mode.

steps.title: Tap the video icon to switch to a video chat.
steps.content: Tap the video icon to switch to a video chat. The other person will have the option to watch or join completely.

steps.title: Hang up by tapping the phone button.
steps.content: Hang up by tapping the phone button. This doesn't actually cut the connection. You'll still be able to hear the other person until they hang up or you exit the chat. Exiting the chat will happen if you switch to any other screen in Snapchat or a different app.

steps.title: Press and hold the Phone button to leave an audio message.
steps.content: Press and hold the Phone button to leave an audio message. If the other person isn't available, or you want to send an audio note, you can leave a brief audio message in the chat by pressing and holding the Phone button. After recording the note, it will be sent to the chat conversation, and the other person can listen when they open the chat.

steps.title: Open Snapchat to the Chats screen.
steps.content: Open Snapchat to the Chats screen. To do so, tap the speech bubble icon at the bottom of the screen. If you haven't done so already, go ahead and go ahead and sign up for a Snapchat account . Video calls are not available in all areas.

steps.title: Open a chat with the person you want to call.
steps.content: Open a chat with the person you want to call. You can do so by tapping the person you want to chat with on the Chats menu or tapping the blue pen-and-paper icon in the lower-right corner and then tapping the person's name. If the person you want to call is not a Snapchat friend, you will need to find out their username and add them as a friend .

steps.title: Tap the Video icon to place a video call.
steps.content: Tap the Video icon to place a video call. If you haven't done this before, you'll be warned that video calls will use mobile data if you aren't connected to a wireless network. The other person will be notified that you're calling them for a video chat. If they have notifications for Snapchat enabled, they'll be notified no matter what they're doing on their phone. If they don't have notifications enabled, they'll only see the call if they're currently using Snapchat. If you get a "Busy ðŸ˜«" message, the recipient cannot answer a call now. You can check if a friend is online using the map .

steps.title: Wait for the other person to pick up.
steps.content: Wait for the other person to pick up. The recipient will be able to either watch your video or join the conversation and share video as well. If you're receiving a video call, tap Watch to see the other person but not show yourself, Join to join the call and send video back, or Ignore to send a "Busy" message.

steps.title: Switch the camera you're using.
steps.content: Switch the camera you're using. You can switch between your front and rear cameras anytime during the chat. Tap your video to make it full-screen, then tap the camera switch button in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Swipe down on the video to minimize it.
steps.content: Swipe down on the video to minimize it. This will let you use other phone features without hanging up on your friend. Tap it again to resume full screen.

steps.title: Tap the Video icon to hang up.
steps.content: Tap the Video icon to hang up. This will not actually end the connection. You'll still be able to see and hear the other person until either they hang up or you close the chat. You can close the chat by switching to another Snapchat screen, switching apps, or closing Snapchat.

steps.title: Press and hold the Video button to record a video message.
steps.content: Press and hold the Video button to record a video message. You'll see a small circle appear while you hold the button. You can record a message up to ten seconds long, and it will play when they open the conversation next. You can cancel the recording by dragging your finger to the "X" button. [1] X Research source
